item.title: Report E-2023100710
item.description:
Report E-2023100710

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-11
  • City: VALPARAISO
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On October 11, 2023, one (1) 337-gallon tote of UN3266 leaked approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer interior due to a loose lid. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to the sodium hydroxide-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged containers were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023100667
item.description:
Report E-2023100667

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-23
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XIN experienced a UN3266 ProClean Egg Wash release from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8' x 9' area of the trailer floor and a 20' x 4' area of the concrete lot below the trailer floor due to a pallet puncture. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents and citric acid solution were utilized to clean and neutralize all impacted areas. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
